question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: new()] [Access Control] Can an attacker gain unauthorized access to the debugger by providing a malicious AptosValidatorInterface implementation that bypasses authentication or leaks sensitive state data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: rest_client()] [Network Security] Does the RestDebuggerInterface properly validate TLS certificates and prevent man-in-the-middle attacks when connecting to remote REST APIs that could expose transaction data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: db()] [File System Access] Can an attacker provide a malicious db_root_path that accesses sensitive files outside the intended database directory through path traversal attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: db()] [Resource Exhaustion] Does opening the database connection properly limit memory usage, or can an attacker cause memory exhaustion by opening extremely large or corrupted database files? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: get_committed_transactions()] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker cause integer overflow by providing maliciously large values for 'begin' + 'limit' that exceed u64::MAX, potentially causing panics or incorrect version ranges? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: get_committed_transactions()] [Information Disclosure] Can an attacker request transactions from versions before genesis (begin=0) or future versions to probe blockchain state or cause undefined behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: get_committed_transactions()] [DoS] Can an attacker request an extremely large 'limit' value (e.g., u64::MAX) causing memory exhaustion when loading all transactions into memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: get_committed_transactions()] [Data Consistency] Are the returned transactions, transaction_infos, and auxiliary_infos guaranteed to be the same length, or can mismatched vector lengths cause out-of-bounds access in downstream code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Signature Bypass] Does the conversion from Transaction to SignatureVerifiedTransaction at line 75 properly validate signatures, or can invalid/malformed transactions bypass signature checks during debugging? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [State Inconsistency] Can executing transactions at an arbitrary version with DebuggerStateView cause state inconsistencies if the version doesn't correspond to actual committed state boundaries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Integer Overflow] Can the repeat_execution_times parameter be set to an extremely large value causing infinite loops or timeout in the nested loops at lines 93-94? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Assertion Failure] Can an attacker trigger the assertion at line 89-92 by providing an empty concurrency_levels slice, causing a panic and crash? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Race Condition] Can concurrent executions with different concurrency_levels create race conditions in the state_view cache, leading to non-deterministic execution results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Output Validation] Can an attacker manipulate execution to produce results where ensure_output_matches returns false, causing the bail at line 114-118 but potentially leaving partial state modifications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can repeatedly executing the same transaction block with high repeat_execution_times exhaust CPU or memory resources, creating a local DoS condition? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Panic Safety] What happens if execute_block_no_limit returns a VMStatus error at line 98 - are resources properly cleaned up, or can this leak memory across multiple execution rounds? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Type Safety] Does the conversion of PersistedAuxiliaryInfo to AuxiliaryInfo at lines 78-81 properly handle all fields, or can missing data cause execution failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transactions_at_version()] [Assertion Failure] Can the assertion at line 126 fail if execute_block_no_limit returns fewer outputs than input transactions, causing a panic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Signature Bypass] Does check_signature() at line 139 properly validate all signature types (Ed25519, MultiEd25519, Secp256k1), or can malformed signatures bypass validation during debugging? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Deprecated Feature] Can an attacker exploit the ModuleBundle check at lines 143-145 to execute deprecated/removed transaction types that should be blocked? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Gas Metering Bypass] Can the modified gas meter in GasProfiler be manipulated to bypass gas limits, allowing execution of transactions that would normally fail due to insufficient gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Information Leakage] Does the gas profiling data returned at line 180 leak sensitive information about internal VM operations, gas calculations, or execution paths that could aid attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Unimplemented Feature] Can an attacker trigger the unimplemented! panic at line 173 by sending a TransactionExecutableRef::Empty payload, causing a crash? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Panic on Error] Can the expect() call at line 160 cause a panic if the executable_ref returns an error for non-module-bundle transactions, creating an unexpected crash? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-debugger/src/aptos_debugger.rs] [Function: execute_transaction_at_version_with_gas_profiler()] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker craft a transaction where the TransactionExecutableRef type mismatches the actual payload, bypassing the pattern matching at lines 158-175?
